title: Ankle Surgery
body: I broke my ankle terribly in three places skiing in January. I flew back to the UK from my holiday and was seen within a few hours in A & E. I was then booked into the fracture clinic, and was operated on within a few weeks. The nursing staff was amazing in day surgery. My surgeon was amazing. Everyone has commented on how well the ankle has been fixed, and how neat the scar is. He is a real asset to the department and I have been amazed with how good the care has been from start to finish. He was personable and professional. the NHS is an amazing asset, and this hospital excels every step of the way. Thank you for fixing my ankle after a terrible injury, and making the process as seamless as possible for me. Amazing department and staff.

title: Inadequate
body:
I’m absolutely shocked to see that this surgery has decided to not let patients know the results of urgent tests! My granddaughter had to check my patient access to overlook results. No message from the DR or anything. Thankfully she works at a surgery in the next town but unfortunately due to addresses I can’t move. 

The staff here are rude, the receptionists believe they are DR’s when in fact couldn’t tell the difference between a cold or a heart attack. Quite frankly the whole area needs improving. 

Also descendant staff need to have some witts about them. I’ve never seen so much dilly dallying around and ladies just having a general chit chat when there is a big queue waiting.

title: Absolutely amazing!
body: On Friday I ended up in A&E with a broken ankle! I would like to sincerely thank each and every one of you who helped me - from all in the A&E department, to the team dealing with x-rays and plaster, to those who pushed me from one side of the hospital to the other, to the doctors and surgeons as well as to the fabulous staff working on the Ainslie ward 🙂  Despite this happening during extremely difficult and troubled times, each of you met me with a smile and showed true professionalism - with a level of care above and beyond the status quo. Amazing teamwork too which led to an absolutely brilliant seamless experience from A-Z! Thank you so much everybody from the bottom of my heart! I’m sure the other ladies who were on the Ainslie would also agree with me! Thank you NHS - stay safe 🌈

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

title: Unsatisfied with this male gp
body: Went to see a doctor about a very painful shoulder as I walked into the doctors room I was greeted with ,and what do we owe the pleasure of your company today,I found this to be sarcastic as I have only been to this doctor twice in the past year and once given the wrong tablets even though I told him I was allergic to this medication.    Anonymous

title: Brilliant team
body: They are always willing and trying to help and fit me in at short notice and sometimes on the day to meet patient needs. I have been with them for many years and I have no reason to want to change surgery. I am extremely happy with the service.

title: repeat prescrriptions
body: Come on Leigh Primary, dig yourself out of the dark ages so that we can get sent repeat prescriptions to our door via the Boots App. Why can't you?

title: Fantastic response
body: Had heart attack, call ambulance 01.50 by 03.50 I had has to stents fitted and was on birch ward. Also my father was in swift ward at the time and both wards kept me untodate about my father and even arrange restspite for him for my recovery. I would like to thank paramedics A/E and both wards for all the care they gave both of us and of course to the team who put my stents in. Thank you all very much.

readBy.name: Ashford and St Peter's Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Caring and reassuring unit.
body: The Doctor and staff were all caring . Very cheerful under the circumstances. Left feeling  reassured.  All precautions taken.

title: Wolfson fertility centre
body:
For some reason it’s not listed in Hammersmith hospital list of depts. It is poles apart from the main hospital - it’s quiet, calm, clean, polite, knowledgeable- they really look after you and on the first go I’ve been successful. I can’t thank them enough - it felt like I was having private health care the whole way through. Don’t hesitate go to the wolfson. 
My only comment that’s negative is the awful pharmacy in Hammersmith hospital where you have to get the medicine. The fertility unit would be on time and quick so u could be in and out but the pharmacy in the hospital (which is separate) let’s down Hammersmith hospital - queues of people , a very rude main dude who mans it who I had to tell not to speak to me like that. It’s always over run and prescriptions can take anywhere from 20 mins to 45 mins to be serviced. This was the bit that made every appointment a 2hr round trip. However don’t let this put you off the wolfson as it’s not their fault how Lloyd’s pharmacy run their business in the main hospital and I’d take the care and knowledge of the ivf unit and calmness of it any day over having fast prescriptions.

title: Dreadful
body:
My child has been known to services at the Phoenix Centre for almost 4 years. Huge waits between appointment that I have had to chase. Different staff each time. Different SALT each time repeating tasks and causing additional
anxiety. Non existent care or support in place, rather a system of observe, report, wait to be observed again in 6-12 months. My child has now been discharged against advice of school, private SALT and comm paeds observations. Seems to be no system to discuss or request reconsideration. Utterly horrendous service which is failing the most vulnerable children in our community.

title: Professionally incompetent
body: How can I describe professionally incompetent, well try this: Turning up a first consultation, for a twenty minute appointment and the doctor hasn’t even got your medical records, when asking questions like ‘i’ve got an acute problem with my heart, so I’ve just been told’, the doctor then shrugging his shoulders and saying ‘well I haven’t got a clue.’.At the same meeting, the only net effect (well because the doctor hadn’t got my medical records), being I had to make a self referral to healthy minds for a mental health condition, spending four months (four months!) trying to get eventually through to a nurse at healthy minds (eventual telephone interview ringback), then been told ‘no you can’t come here’, we’re referring you back to your doctor and complex care. I thought no don’t do that, I’ll die of old age before I get into complex care, then they’ll only tell me to get a job stacking shelves in Morrisons. Then there was the practices policy on the ‘effectively’ bed ridden, which must be locked in a vault somewhere, because still till this day a year after joining the practice and despite numerous emails and being ‘effectively’ bed ridden I still till to this day, haven’t got a clue what there policy is?, assuming they have any policies at all, it’s all a bit ‘ad hoc’ down Penn Manor. I’ve met a doctor that hasn’t got a clue on the practices policies, you’re lucky if they’ve got your medical records and even if they have they are a shambles. Then there was the doctor who was supposed to see me (as I sort of lay in bed in constant pain), well he couldn’t be bothered showing up could he, the practice is only 5 minutes away. I had an ambulance driver attend me, he spent two hours with me, whilst I was in constant pain, he said ‘it’s not much, but I can get your doctor to see you tomorrow.’, but of course the doctor never showed up, I think my brother pursued the matter for two weeks, ‘where is this doctor!’, well then gave up. Cost me six months in bed in constant pain, after say four years of exactly the same thing!. Then there was the doctor who well said ‘I have reviewed the letter we have received from Nottingham Hospital. She has advised as you had no acute cardiac problem when she saw you she feels that no referral is required at present.’. I’ve got it in writing. Well I hadn’t been over in Nottingham for 5 years, I had been in Wolverhampton, the last 5 years!, she sat in the appointment and she said ‘well I need to get medical records over from Nottingham on your heart’. I said ‘why?, I’ve been camped out in some Wolverhampton cardiology dept for the last year, it’s only up the road.’, no she wasn’t having it!. So she spent six weeks, received some letter from Nottingham, who hadn’t seen me for 5 years! (sort of ignored I was at Wolverhampton cardiology), won’t be making a referral to Wolverhampton cardiology (where I was) and was due to undertake 6 monthly check-ups but missed one because I was till Ill to attend (bed ridden).

title: Exceptional staff and doctors
body: The practice manager should be applauded for this lovely practice. The doctors are thorough and friendly, reception staff helpful and everywhere spick and span. At my previous gp’s 45 minute waits in a dingy waiting room and a rude secretary were standard. At Hornchurch Healthcare its light, bright and modern.

title: Very professional and very friendly
body: In a situation like this when you are about to go into surgery and feel extremely vunlerable friendliness means alot. And also to have professionals to deal with you so that you feel like you are in safe hands. The doctor and surgeon was very reassuring and I appreciated to see pictures and get it explained after the surgery. Thank you so much all of you whohelped me and did such a fantastic job. God bless and may He keep you safe in these hard times.

title: Personal, professional service from all staff
body: I have never had anything other than exemplary service from all the staff at the Emerson’s Green health centre.  From the knowledgeable receptionists, to the nurses and GPs who have always efficiently diagnosed the issues presented with humour, kindness and honesty;  I cannot recommend them highly enough.  Even during the current pandemic, they quickly secured me an appointment and made me feel as if I was an old friend they were just ‘helping out’.  I now have what I need in terms of reassurance and medication in order to allow me to continue to care for my family during these uncertain times.  Many thanks to you all.

title: Excellent hospital
body: My mum broke her hip after tripping over while going for a walk and the emergency services were incredible. The ambulance arrived quickly and the medics were so kind to her and explained everything to us. When my mum got to hospital she was cared for swiftly and was assigned a ward. In the ward the nurses were, once again, incredible. We couldn’t thank the staff more for their empathy and kindness for all they have done for her and us!

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

author: Aarrggh
title: I felt that I was being talked down to
body:
I felt that the receptionists that I met were rude and that I was talked down to. I also did not like the doctor's attitude and it seemed that they believe everything wrong is related to one thing.  
You go in to be helped but even speaking to them raises your blood pressure. Even worse when you go with a disabled patient. It feels like they don't want to know.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Belgium bun
title: The drs surgery in general
body:
My dealings with this surgery are the worst I've ever had. I have found it impossible to get a appointment even before the pandemic came in. We would have to ring 111 to get a dr and medication as could never get a dr.  
The doctor has been completely insensitive to people with mental health and made the situation worse for us, prescription have never been done when they should have been and the receptionists phone manner has been appalling.  
As the pandemic is here we can not get a new surgery but I will once we can register to a new one as fed up how you are treated as a patient it is unacceptable

author: muki
title: First midwife appointment
body:
When I was barely able to see the line on my first pregnancy test in November 2019, I called my medical practice, Cripps Medical Centre. They asked me to do another test in a week's time, after which I called again. From then on, every time, they told me to wait another week or two, and finally gave me another telephone number to call, without explanation. It turned out that this was Radford Medical Practice, the central place for making a first midwife appointment in Nottingham. I provided my contact details and never heard back. I called and called, having many problems getting through to a midwife, and then again, being told to wait another week or two, and that they will call me back. At week 13, they had me 'on the radar' and by week 14, things were very urgent and everything suddenly had to happen. I had just started a new job, not told anyone at work about the pregnancy yet and I don't drive, making same-day visits on the other side of the city in the middle of the day quite difficult. I felt like a failure, with the indirect messages, also coming from midwives and nurses, that the baby was not important to me. I was terrified of losing my job, as I was in the middle of a four-week probationary period, although, as mentioned above, I had called the medical practices as early as possible. I was suddenly swamped with appointments all over the city, during the day, with the longest lasting 3 hours, which I had to work around. It was very stressful. I did then have a community midwife appointment local to where I live.  
I don't know what went wrong, as everyone I told this story has been surprised. I felt not cared about, including the baby. At the worst points, I considered abortion, because I felt utterly powerless to do my job as a mother, while at the same time facing the accusations for it. The problem was that I had no idea, how pregnancy works in the healthcare system - and no one to ask! The messages from the medical practices were contradictory (call later / call the other number / we don't do pregnancy tests - how should I know??)  
Once I got into the system, my first scan was arranged quickly for NUH things improved and the healthcare professionals there and at Queens were very caring, friendly and helpful. It took a while, before the situation relaxed. I also passed my probation and my colleagues have been very supportive, which is kind of a happy end to the story.

author: FFMN13
title: Lack of communication
body:
My father unfortunately had to be admitted to ward 6 at Monklands hospital for investigations and subsequent treatment for whatever is ailing him. He was taken - alone - from the house by paramedics (these guys were great) and had information pertaining to next-of-kin and contact numbers. All I knew was that he was going to Monklands and I have to say that I am disappointed that I did not receive any communication from the hospital as to his whereabouts. These are very trying and difficult times for us all, but surely, when removing people from their home to hospital on their own, with concerned family providing contact details, why are they not been informed of where their relative is?  
I fully understand and appreciate the need to reduce the volume of people in the hospital at the present time, hence visiting restrictions.  
However, when phoning for information as to his progress, presentation and results of investigations/tests, I was told that they are limited to the information they can give you over the phone.  
I fully understand and appreciate the need for confidentiality, however my father has consented for information sharing with his nominated next-of-kin. This clearly cannot be done face-to-face at present, therefore what changes are being implemented to ensure that the appropriate information is being shared with nominated next-of-kin?

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Daveyloon
title: Urology Department Care
body:
Over the last month I've had two visits to ARI hospital for minor operations to do with kidneys stones.  
I just want to express my thanks to everyone I came in contact with for the care and professionalism they showed.  
From the initial visit for blood tests in 209 (and a surprise admission the same day) everyone was helpful and pleasant and the medical staff reassuring in their explanations.  
The second visit was well into the COVID 19 crisis and again such calm professionalism in what must be constant changes to processes and staffing made my visit as pleasant as possible. Thanks this time to all in ward 210.  
The tools and techniques you use may all be day to day stuff to you guys but the procedures you have to help deal with this problem are amazing to me and much appreciated.  
Thanks to all involved again.

title: NHS at its very best
body: I called 111 on the 15th March from that moment on I had the best care possible, from the ambulance crew who were so kind, to Ambulatory Services, the  holding unit ward, Cardiology and Barts. All the staff were amazing kind humans who treated me with dignity and respect as I felt very vulnerable. I was taken by ambulance to Barts for an angiogram then back to Whipps, the crew teams were all so professional. I have had a long rooted fear of hospitals. I have to have another test to be sure of the diagnosis. Thank you all from the bottom of my heart. The nurses and staff in Cardiology were fantastic. We are so lucky to have our NHS.

title: Great care
body: I was admitted to ward, 32 on, 23rd March and tested positive for corona virus. As a patient with underlying medical issues I received the best treatment possible from doctors and nurses who were magnificent even though they were working under extreme pressure. I was kept informed of what was happening and what I could expect if my condition worsened. Being isolated from family was very difficult but the staff were very understanding. I can't thank you enough for getting me through this when the outcome could have been much worse due to my underlying medical conditions. Thank you.

title: Incredibly rude reception staff + practice…
body: I always find the reception staff at this practice lack people skills and compassion when conversing with the public. I’ve found this to be the case and I’ve been at this practice for many years. The practice manager in particular has been incredibly rude to me right now on the phone: talking over me, was condescending, not listening to me and being obtuse. Why is it that you read these reviews and the same problem keeps cropping up, the reception staff?! They need replacing with more compassionate and caring people. The practice manager, she is incredibly poor at talking over the phone. I rang in, concerned about the health of my family, and she was condescending throughout the chat. Absolutely awful. I am now extremely tempted to find another surgery, this problem is getting worse with these awful staff members allowed to stay. You may say they receive regular training but it is clearly not evident and they are failing in their role towards the public. Awful - avoid this surgery!!!

title: Unhelpful when my child needed a consultation
body: Called for an appointment this morning, after 40 minutes was told my child isn’t registered, despite dad filling out the paperwork nearly 12 months ago. Was told that my child was still registered at previous practice. Call them, not registered there. Call lion health back was told to register. Problem is my child needs advice from GP today. Call 111 they ask ‘is your child still registered with lion health?’ As that is what they have on record!! Now my child has to go to urgent care,  which we have avoided all weekend as they are under considerable stress and it’s a risk we didn’t want to put our family in. I just fail to understand how someone can no longer be registered.

title: Consistently Having Issues
body:
First and foremost I'd like to make it clear these issues have been occuring more or less since I joined the practice 2 or so years ago so this is not due to Coronavirus or current affairs impacting the surgery.

I have a long term health condition and require essential medication daily. I have had this condition for 10 years plus and have never had so many issues in getting a repeat prescription before.

Every single month for as long as I can remember I have had to request my prescription multiple times to go to my nominated pharmacy who I have also requested the medication from. They regularly tell me that the surgery is not requesting the prescription, thankfully they are kind enough to give me emergency prescriptions as they've told me they've had complaints from others about the surgery.

The reception staff both male and female (unsure of names) are 9 times out of 10 rude, they regularly speak over me and don't allow me to explain clearly what my issue is so the phone call takes 5 times longer and have to explain myself multiple times. They can also be extremely condescending, luckily I am young and not vulnerable so can't imagine how unpleasant it can be for more vulnerable and elderly patients to be spoken to in such a way.

I have tried my best to be as pleasant and understanding as possible, especially given the circumstances but to say I am growing short on patience is an understatement. There have been multiple instances I have run out of medication needlessly for 3-4 and have been left feeling very unwell.

Today I asked to raise a complaint and was completely dismissed, I was told that because of corona it has caused issues, when I explained this was ongoing for a long time it was completely ignored and no offer to look into the isse, just stated well I don't know why this has happened - neither do I and would love to have an answer. After having to take time off from work today for a phone consultation to get an emergency supply of medication (which the receptionist told me was impossible until I complained conisistently to be offered one) I still have no answers.

This has left me feeling upset and stressed out month to month and I would like a resolution. 
I will be making a formal complaint regarding this matter.

author: catsandflowers
title: Serious Lack of Professionalism and Care
body: I went for an assessment here and in my opinion I feel it was not even worth going. I felt the woman who spoke to me was unhelpful and had absolutely no intention of helping me with my mental health problems. I actually feel worse after attending this appointment.

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

title: Missing items
body: Three times in the past year my Mum has been admitted by ambulance to A+E + due to moving to other wards her clothes have been going missing. her false teeth also. have been to the hospital at the end of last year but they could not find them + told me they would have been incinerated if not claimed. now on my Mums recent visit her holdall that my Dad packed for her has now gone missing. trying to find her property is a joke. My dad is getting fed up with this now. they are both in their 80s + my Mum has dementia so cannot look after her own property. why are items not listed by the staff + moved with the patient..

readBy.name: University Hospitals Bristol and Weston NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Clinicians and Lovely Setting
body: The clinic itself is always beautiful and clean. All of the staff are informative, friendly and willing to help you as much as they can. I had CBT for health anxiety and found it to be much more effective that any prior therapy I have had. My clinician was very understanding and taught me techniques as well as listened to all of my troubles. I have now gone from worrying 24/7 to having the occasional thought every 2 weeks. All around a great experience and would definitely recommend to anyone.

author: CeeCee123
title: Pacemaker insertion
body: I have had congenital heart block since birth but had required no treatment until my late 30s when I developed some symptoms. I was given a really thorough examination by the cardiology department and a pacemaker was deemed the best course of action. I was issued an appointment for surgery within the next 4 weeks and was given very useful leaflets and booklets which answered all my questions as well as a pre appointment with a nurse who answered the rest. At first I was nervous as I am younger than most people who require a pacemaker but with the support of the medical staff I ended up just feeling really grateful to the NHS for providing the treatment I needed. A very special thank you to Dr Carrick in Cardiology and to Dr Weir, Tracy, Annette and Eric in the Cath lab.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: OB
title: Attended A&E with chest pains
body:
I was feeling very unwell all day before attending the A&E department but didn’t want to put pressure on the staff so left it as long as I could.  
As soon as I arrived I was seen within minutes, the male nurse couldn’t have been better, he was very compassionate and accommodating. Other staff were constantly asking if there was anything I needed and made me feel very at ease.  
The whole process was just delightful, I honestly couldn’t thank you all more! I would like for the male nurse to receive some sort of gratitude along with all of the other staff on that shift for just being kind hearted and reassuring!

author: Izzicrich
title: Fantastic Service from the team
body:
Three weeks ago I underwent major surgery on my ankle at Sunderland Royal Hospital... my care on Ward 48D was stressful in view of the Corona-virus, however the nurses were helpful..  
My reason for my review is that whist in hospital I had a cast put on by Dave and his colleagues in the Plaster Room.... I would just like to say it was my first time having a cast on and I was feeling very nervous... the atmosphere was fantastic... they made me feel so relaxed and even made me laugh... I have recently returned to the Plaster Room to have another cast applied and I was not at all frightened of the process and once again a fantastic service from Dave and his colleague especially working long hours during this awful time... Well Done guys !!!

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Disappointing
body: I phoned to ask to cancel prescription waiting at pharmacy as unable to pick up as isolating son is vulnerable I am his caregiver but also have health issues so signed up to online pharmacy so prescription can be delivered save putting my son at risk I had phoned earlier in the week but where not helpful I’ve run out of medication online chemist recommends doctors write out prescription to fill gap have local pharmacy deliver friary house are not helpful stay in help keep vulnerable safe help the nhs what part did friary surgery not listen to receptionist repeatedly told me to go get prescription did it under duress made my blood boil thankyou for your support

title: Absolutely disgusting
body: My daughters glasses have been too small for her over a year now and at her last appointment (about 6 weeks ago) they told us they were not going to change them until the next appointment (today), as she’d need a new prescription.. fair enough. Went today and the person that does the prescriptions is sick!! I called this morning and they told me what appointments she had, yet, they didn’t think to mention this? My husband was told to wait in the waiting room for him, then was told “oh, he’s off sick”. Really? So, now my daughter has to wait another 6 WEEKS with her glasses digging into the side of her face! Wrong!!

title: Long waiting times that go unanswered
body:
Currently been on Hold for 2 hours ad 50 mins, no answer. 

Feel now they are just not answering calls as they are overrun. So good luck if you have covid-19, you cant leave the house and no one will answer or come out to treat you.

title: Dermatology
body:
My husband has attended Rowan House twice in the last couple of weeks. The staff have all been fantastic. He has been seen in very quick time. 
The surgeon who removed his lump was extremely friendly and expert at his job, thank you Toby.
Can't fault anything about this hospital.
Well done and thank you, each and every member of staff.

author: magpiehq53
title: Breast Services
body: I found a lump in my breast and when I went to have it checked they didn't even scan that part of my breast, only scanned one small part on one breast and I'm sure missed where the lump actually is.

author: KMichelle
title: Ward C8, our heroes
body:
My Dad was recently admitted to c8 with Covid 19.  
I just want to say a huge thank you to all the doctors and nurses who went above and beyond for my family and my Dad. My Mom will be forever in their debt, their kindness has no limits.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: All time bad experience
body: I am suffer for a cough and flu last for 3 month when I called for appointment they said go to pharmacy.i request them I have tried lots of thing but I am not better but they don’t understand and I mentioned her name miss or mrs (ash).as a mother of two daughters I have difficulty to take care of my daughters.my daughter is 9 month old and she has ear infection because of phone apppiontment these days doctor said no need to give her anything 100 of time I requested that yellowish water is come out from her ear but they never bother.

author: Emz87
title: Protecting people
body: I think that it is a disgrace that the receptions have no PPE there is no perplex glass there haven't been given gloves there is no hand sanitizers for staff or patients to use. How are we supposed to stop the spread of Covid-19 if we are not protecting people putting themselves at risk for us.

author: JBmac19
title: Standard of care was amazing
body:
I gave birth last month. The care I received all through my pregnancy was outstanding. Every midwife I saw reassured me and helped answer any questions I had for them.  
I had originally planned to go to Paisley to have my baby but when I went into labour I didn't feel like I could manage the journey and decided to have my baby in Oban.  
I could not have been happier with the care and support from the two midwives that delivered my baby. They were both calm and made me feel at ease the whole time. I could not rate them highly enough and I am so relieved that I changed my plans and decided to stay in Oban.  
After the birth of my baby the standard of care was amazing. The midwives contacted me every day and helped support me through breast feeding. I am now confident in breast feeding thanks to the amazing advice and help revived from the midwife team.  
I cannot rate the team in Oban highly enough and would recommend anyone to have their baby here. It turned out to be the best decision I ever made.  
Thank you all so much.

author: Bedford
title: The high quality of care and attention I received on my stay
body:
I was on holiday at Cricket St Thomas when I was unwell . My wife called for an ambulance and the result being that I was taken to the Musgrove in Taunton. The professionalism of the staff in A&E was absolutely first class although I can remember little of it due to my serious condition. After a while i was transferred to the SAU ward where the staff were exemplary at all times, despite having some difficult patients.  
Having been diagnosed with a Heart Attack ,Pancreatitus, damaged Bile duct and gall stones plus infections , the care and attention to detail given by Mr Vickery and his team was very reassuring.No doubt my medical records from Royal Papworth were of considerable interest but I felt that your staff needed to be fully aware of my colourful cardiac history!  
After a brief stay in Montacute Wing I was transferred to Fielding Ward. Once again the staff were brilliant and caring.There I was looked after by Ward staff led by Richard ,Anna and Maggie and my recovery was very well managed. I was finally discharged by Mr Dayer with appropriate instructions to complete the course of anti-biotics and to lose some weight. A bit personal but noted and being acted upon (I've lost a stone+ since discharge. My discharge was at least one day premature but was dictated by being able to get back to Bedford and the lockdown starting.  
I am now recuperating at home awaiting follow up appointments from Royal Papworth and Bedford Hospitals. No doubt these will not take place until the Covid 19 crisis is resolved.  
Once again I would like to express my gratitude to the paramedics and excellent dedicated staff of the Musgrove.Congratulations on being such a brilliant example of the NHS at its very best.  
Would you please ensure this message is passed to the relevant clinicians and nurses.  
With my Deepest Gratitude.

title: Year on year good practice
body: We have been with Northgate practice for many years. Over the last 10 years my husband has received treatment for a variety of complex health care needs. Many of these treatments have resulted in hospital intervention also. We are fortunate to have such excellent care practitioners including the nursing staff as well as the doctors in one centre. Well done

title: Very helpful
body: I have called the practice twice in the last 3 weeks and found the Practice staff and Doctors to be very friendly and most helpful during what must be such a trying time for everyone at the practice. THANK YOU ALL.

author: melonbg87
title: Business as usual
body: I needed to call an ambulance beginning of the month, which was not Covid-19 related. The response from the team was top-notch and "business as usual' despite the craziness we're currently experiencing. Shout-outs for Ambulance crew (Simon, Anthony & Kristina), and for follow-up Specialist Paramedic Antonio! Thanks guys.

title: Always on Hand to help
body: Never had a problem with the surgery they have always helped as quick as they can with the problems me and my family have had, always pleasant and kind and welcoming.

title: Best practice by far.
body:
I have been a patient at this practice for over 24years. Not only are the doctors Very professional, there so down to earth, so caring, as are the nurses. The receptionists are in a league of there own, they go out there way to help you, in anyway they can, there just fab.
A fantastic practice, a fantastic team xxx

author: Ohhappyday
title: The practitioner didn't listen to me.
body:
I waited 1 year for iapt mental health Barnsley to give me a practitioner. I started the sessions, and at the second session I felt terrible and put the phone down on the practitoner. The practitioner was awful and didn't listen to me, had an attitude, no empathy and kept telling me they didn't want a debate.  
When they told me what I need to do, there was no rapport built had no idea of my needs or disability and was abrupt and rude and I can't believe they said they felt there is a resistance to what I am saying. Your solutions are not realistic I don't want a debate I was nearly crying so I ended the call.

title: Looked after really well
body:
I wrote a review posted on 6 December 2019 with the same heading as above. This covered my Chemo Therapy at the Pevensey Day Unit. Moving on to Radiotherapy at the Radiotherapy Unit I wondered how they could possibly match the Pevensey Day Unit care.
WELL THEY DID!
They were very exact getting me in the right position for the treatment and explained fully what was happening. They were very kind and we shared good humour whenever possible.
They were also very patient while I was working to get the timing of my pre-treatment formalities correct in the early days. 
Once again, I cannot praise the staff enough.

title: Staff should be ashamed of themselves
body: This hospital needs urgent review! Patients' rights are being ignored and their needs severely neglected. The majority of staff are unprofessional, ill-trained in mental health, aggressive and pose a serious threat to the well-being of vulnerable patients (including both verbal and physical abuse). The doctors/consultants above them are just as bad. They do not keep patients informed, do not respect their rights and simply ignore very serious issues raised with them. The "ward rounds" are absolute nonsense and just a tick box exercise. I am appalled at how someone, especially a so-called "professional", could mistreat another person in this way.  Sadly, the Trust will not step up until a patient is seriously hurt, and then, at the very least, I hope every staff member (whether the lead consultant or a HCA) is found to be culpable.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

title: Things have improved
body: If people can use the online gp consult I would 100% recommend it. You don’t need to necessarily have an appointment and go into the GP for a face to face appt. You will save yourself much time and stress filling in the consultation form. I’ve managed to consult with a GP at Sma online when I had an ear infection (you can actually upload Photos too) and also when I had tonsillitis. I got antibiotics same day. I also get my repeat prescriptions just filling in this form. I’ve also had numerous referrals via this as well. Please people start using this! It saves so much time and you just have to fill in a questionnaire. You get replies within 24 hours max. GPS on the nhs are under a huge amount of pressure and it’s not possible to get same day appointments at times. The only negative feedback is that the attitude of the receptionists needs to improve. They are not polite on the phone and haven’t been for years. I think also it should be advertised more that people use this online gp site and then people might be more eager to use it if they know more about it and the benefits of using it.

title: Amazing midwife
body: We had our baby here back in September and we feel so grateful to have had such a great midwife. She was so lovely and patient (even whilst getting an earful of screaming from me, Sorry!) and made our experience so calming. She was also in charge of our care back on the ward which we were so relieved about and was always popping in to check on us. We honestly can’t thank her enough for everything that she did and for making our experience so positive. :-)

title: Dreadful practice
body: Fortunately I seldom need to make use of the services of this practice because since I moved here in February 2014 the service has been appalling. Contacting the surgery is nigh on impossible, phone lines are constantly engaged, keep you on hold for extended periods or cut off for no reason. There is no e-mail address and the on-line access has been changed without any communication with current users. The web site still links through to the obsolete system. I've bee trying to order a repeat prescription totally without success. Not allowed by phone, fax number links to voicemail so only option is by post and I'm supposed to be self isolating due to Covid 19 so how is that possible. I'll be moving to another practice as soon as this virus problem is over.

title: Literally life savers!
body: Can’t thank this service enough. The trauma ward and all the staff was amazing I’m from manchester and had a accident in London. I was in the most vulnerable state, had no family or many friends around me at the time.  due to Injurys in both arms I was unable to move elbow down .  I was unable to do anything for my self and At this most tragic time in my life and I I was in the  best care possible and I had nothing except endlesss care. I thank all the nurses doctors surgeons, and assistants and the ambulance seeivie It’s emotionally to talk about the event but I wouldn’t. E here  with out any of you, it’s been 14 months scince my accident and I’m Still in recovery, hence the the delayed review I wanted to thank all the NHS! Use do an amazing job ❤️

title: Wouldn't recommend to anyone
body: I don't even know where to begin on how bad this place is not only do the receptionist ask questions when you need an appointment when only the doctor needs to know it's the fact you put in a repeat prescription and you don't get the items you put down and they don't care even if you have none of the medication left also even if you have been taking the tablets for ages for an condition they keep saying they haven't gone through to the chemist because another doctor who doesn't work there wants to know why you have them, that should all be on my record! I have had family members who haven't been treated right here and have ended up in hospital because of it, plus with this coronavirus you can't get through to them and they are not accepting prescriptions! You have to do them electronically what about the people who can't do that? They don't care and are just a poor doctors all together wouldn't recommend to anyone at all.

author: R King
title: Care of my Mother in Kingfisher ward
body:
Awful environment to see my Mum in. 4 bed ward with 5 beds in. No option for her to have privacy. The food she was served was disgusting,. Staff who treated my mum.. Some good some really bad, especially at night.  
Mum did not feel safe. Never saw 1 nurse/physio/Dr/Healthcare Assistant wash their hands/use sanitiser! We only saw staff in charge once in 2 weeks, putting up signs ref Covid 19. I decided to get my Mum out of that environment and care for her myself by taking 6 weeks unpaid leave from work.  
OT who brought my Mum home was patient but seemed under pressure and on a strict timescale. Glad I opted to care for my Mum myself as the care received was extremely poor.

author: lesley524
title: Stroke rehabilitation
body:
It's been nice to work with the therapists and get better bit by bit. They've given us exercises on paper and that's helped because it's hard to remember everything. We've looked up some exercises on you tube because some of them are paper are hard to understand but watching the videos helps.  
He's not back to normal - his vision and getting about aren't the same and he gets frustrated that he can't do what he used to - he never got frustrated before.  
His eating and drinking are back to normal and that's nice.  
Kirsty, Rhea, Bev, Shelley and Margaret have all been kind and patient and good to work with.

author: Grateful Neighbour
title: Abdominal surgery...
body:
I was fortunate to have open surgery on two hernias on the 10th March, just before the Covid - 19 restrictions came into place. I felt very lucky that my surgery went ahead and cosseted from the crisis that staff were facing; a reflection of their care and professionalism.  
Facing surgery with a variety of health issues was a worry, and I was greatly reassured by the diligence of all that looked after me.  
Thank you to Dr. Kennedy, Consultant Anaesthetist, his team and the theatre staff for looking after me during my surgery.  
Thank you to all the staff on Montacute Ward - aren't we lucky to have such an amazing building!  
Thank you to Staff Nurses: Michelle - so lovely to see a familiar face when I arrived on the ward - Romanian Anna, Italian Anna and Adam (still can't believe that you admitted to supporting Chelsea!) for your cheerful and thorough care.  
Thank you to Health Care Assistants: Freya, Milly and Elaine for your patience and kindness.  
Thank you to Mr Noble, General Surgeon, and his team for looking after me during and after my surgery. I immediately felt the benefit of the operation and know how fortunate I was to have been given a negative pressure dressing; my wound has healed beautifully - thank you.  
I am truly grateful for the excellent care that I received. We are so lucky to have the NHS and should not take it for granted at any time.  
Thank you to ALL in the NHS for facing the current crisis with such professionalism and selflessness. Thank you.❤

author: Mrs M0-0
title: Covid19
body:
I started feeling unwell, night sweats, cold symptoms then 3 days later the cough started, I’d already literally gave up eating as it made me feel sick.  
The Saturday was awful, couldn’t stop vomiting but due to not eating anything there was nothing to bring up. We phoned 111 it took over an hour to get thru but the call handler was lovely. A doctor called back and said it sounded like I had the virus and got a prescription sent to the chemist for anti sickness pills and antibiotics for a possible chest infection. The anti sickness pills stopped me throwing up but didn’t deal with the constant nausea. I couldn’t get out of bed or eat so had no energy.  
A few days after my call to 111, I phoned my gp as I was so distressed with the nausea. They said because I’d called 111 before I had to call them again, it was nothing to do with them. I called 111 and was basically told that it didn’t matter that I hadn’t eaten for nearly a week as long as I was drinking fluids I’d be fine and that was it. The following day I took another turn and started being sick again, still not eating, was still having night sweats. My husband called 111 this time and spoke to someone who got a nurse to call me back and I had to explain everything which reduced me to tears, then someone else phoned me back from the covid19 centre and had to explain it again. They said they would send a doctor out. By this time it was early hours of the morning.  
The doctor arrived and made me explain it all again as I was trying to throw up continuously. They gave me a different anti sickness pill, again said food didn’t matter just plenty of fluids and any more problems to contact my own GP -I explained they weren’t interested and they said they’d have to be. Not once did they listen to my chest which is still wheezing now. It’s been a week now and I’ve had a piece of toast. Tiny steps. But I’m still worried about my wheezing/breathing and I don’t know where to turn to ask someone to have a listen to it to see if I have a problem.  
I understand people are busy and scared but I cannot believe how difficult nigh impossible it is to see someone just to get your chest checked!!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Office of Ken Macintosh, MSP for West of Scotland

author: RLK
title: Home talk with Hazel
body:
Our son has always showed delayed speech, this was picked up on our 2 year review.  
After discussing the options we decided with the health visitor to proceed with home talk.  
Then we met Hazel, she has helped us develop his speech in so many different ways.  
In a time of worry and uncertainly with our child Hazel was quick to reassure us and teach us the correct way to ease him into speaking.  
We are not where we need to be but have come such a long way, Hazel has now referred our son so we have been 'passed over', however Hazel has always been quick to reassure us never to hesitate to contact her with any questions or queries.  
Thank you hazel.

title: Deplorable
body:
Have been registered for ten years, the doctors are OK no issues but the receptionists  and admin staff are a nightmare , too many service failings and avoidable mistakes unhelpful and generally rude. Ie hang up on you, cancel your appointment at last minute and/or fail to let you know appointment is.cancelled, the mistakes are too numerous to write on here. They do not help, only hinder.
They tell you to complain in writing then just ignore your complaint, no reply.
Too many emails and the practice manager sends out nasty letter alleging aggression, and threatens police, all because the patient has had no other choice but to write emails in frustration, not aggressive nor angry at all.
He should be fired for not addressing the errors the admin make and ignoring complaints, this is maladministration and needs to be addressed by the NHS.
It is the patient that is manipulated by this insidious manager, paid to run business but driving it away with his allegations and threats.
This is where NHS money gets drained as patients concerns are trashed yet the practice still get paid for service they fail in and don’t provide.
This needs investigating and auditing, no manager should be allowed to get away with threatening and defaming patients, that abusive threatening letter could kill some weak patient or make them ill. It certainly impacted on my health, I have made a formal complaint to the individual concerned but no reply and to the GP in charge, again no reply.
It is all very underhand, but does not stop here.
I will now get a reply of fake sincerity that they are looking into it, nothing could be further from the truth. 
They need an admin overhaul, new manager instated that addresses service failings and does not send out threatening defamatory letters to patients without trying to contact and discuss it with patients first , this is a knee jerk reaction to avoid taking responsibility for their own failings.
New admin and receptionists needed to as the rot has set in and old habits hard to break.
Patients should not be driven away with threatening letters

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Caring and Wonderful Practice
body: Through the many years of being a patient at Tower Family Health Care (formally known as Tottington Health Centre) both myself and my family cannot fault the care and considerate dedication of medical professionals, the patience and kindness from the reception staff to the clinicians. Especially at this time while the NHS is experiencing enormous pressures on its services, but heroically meeting the challenge  with dignity, grace and dedication. I feel mortified that I missed the deadline date to fill in the, NHS 'GP Patient Survey' and wish to put on record my apologies, but also my thanks for all the wonderful work that they do. I now it would be wonderful to more easily access appointments with the GPs we want to see, but on the whole the practice always strives to deliver the absolute best in care and advice, so 'Thank You' Tower Family Health Care for all that you do and all that you are, you are our 'Heroes' especially at the moment. All will be well, and life will return to normal once more :)

title: Superb care
body:
Took my son for nail surgery removal today. The team were absolutely superb and a credit to their profession. 
I can’t thank them enough for treating him during this uncertain time.
They provide plenty of information about what they were doing and also aftercare.
They made sure to make my son as comfortable as possible and the procedure was painless and quick.

title: Fantastic care and support
body: At this very difficult time that we are in together, I would like to comment on the the great support and care that is provided by the Doctors House Surgery. My mother is a elderly vulnerable patient and because of the recent situation it’s very difficult. The wonderful and caring Doctor at the surgery has been very helpful, contacting her via telephone conversation, asking about her welfare, arranging repeat prescriptions and keeping a weekly update via, of course telephone conversation which is very reassuring and comforting. The care and support is Above and beyond. And it’s show’s that the elderly and vulnerable patients like my elderly mother are very important to the Doctors House Surgery. Wonderful caring Doctor and fantastic reception staff. Thank you for taking care of me and my family.

title: Fantastic Experience
body: Like most first time patients I was extremely worried and concerned prior to my first cataract operation.  I am nervous at the best of times, especially when it comes to eye examinations.  I was fortunate in that I managed to have my first op prior to the current covid-19 lockdown.  The staff at SpaMedica in Manchester are amazing.  The receptionists, Nurses, Medics and Surgeons are so friendly, patient and professional.  The actual procedure took around 10 minutes.  Drops are put into the eye to freeze it and you feel a slight pressure on the eye.  If I can go through the procedure anyone can.  My eyesight is very bad, I am short sighted.  On the trip home; my wife was driving; about an hour following the operation I was able to read the car number plate in front of us.  Unfortunately due to the current lockdown I am awaiting the second operation.  Thank you to everyone, and I look forward to seeing you all again.

title: Brilliant Caring Practice
body:
Approaching 70, I have experienced a fair number of Doctors surgeries over the years.  I'm delighted to report that the High Road Surgery manages to combine good service with a seemingly genuine interest in their patients. It is a very refreshing approach in these days where most organisations one has to deal with see the individual as just a faceless number.
To be able to get an appointment within days, to have the GP follow up a surgery visit with a follow up phonecall are things that just don't happen in other surgeries.
My wife and I would like to offer our sincere thanks for the excellent service that the Doctors and the support staff provide.

title: Best in Bolton even during Covid 19
body: I came for a ultrasound scan with ScanAssure back in January time after being sent by my doctor. I was initially due to go else where but the company that should have done that scan told me there was a 8 week wait.  Not wanting to wait that long i contacted ScanAssure who told me thay could scan me within 7 days and in Bolton. The scan went ahead and the chap who did they scan explained that the body part the doctor had asked him to scan looked fine and did the report. He explained to me he thought the pain i was experiencing was referred pain and would like to do another scan as he was confident he knew what my problem was, but without a referral from the doctor for that specific body part he was unable to do that scan. I returned to my doctor and asked for a new referral. This was sent to the original company I was due to go to back in January, despite me insisting I would like to go back to ScanAssure. My scan was booked with the other company. I appreciate its difficult times for all but my scan was cancelled 4 times. 4 times i took time off work and 4 times it was cancelled. I contacted ScanAssure personally and was told there Scans were still going ahead, adhering to strict Cornoavirus guidelines and safety precautions. My scan took place 3 days later, the same guy who my first scan, was wearing protective equipment and he diagnosed my straight away with what he though I had several weeks ago. I can now get the treatment I need and stop worrying. Thanks again, truly are the best.

title: Amazing doctors
body: During the corona outbreak,my son come down with really bad tonsillitis, the doctors gave me a telephone appointment listened to what I said instead of rushing me and had my son sent over some antibotics, reducing the risk of him going into the doctors with a low immune system! Thank you

title: Great practice
body:
I have been a patient with a long-term health condition at this practice for over 25yrs now and have always been treated in a friendly, efficient & timely manner, but these are difficult times at the moment with our NHS services stretched to breaking point courtesy of Covid-19! 

So I was amazed to get a call out of the blue by one of the Doctors there just as we'd gone into lock-down. 

The week before she'd rung to let me know that the blood tests requested by my specialist consultant had come back clear, which was great to know but didn't really help to shed any light on the symptoms i was experiencing. We'd agreed then that i would contact him direct to see how to proceed with it, bearing in mind we could see things were probably about to change because of Covid-19, but he knew me and my condition well. 

The call, she said, was just to check that i was okay and hadn't fallen down a gap in the services which might have left me feeling even more vulnerable.  I was very touched and grateful for her thoughtfulness! 

Lock-down hasn't come at the best time for me health-wise but all of the staff at the John Hampden Surgery have been very supportive and understanding, and have ensured that I've had the telephone consultations and any necessary medication in a very timely way. 

I'm so grateful that I'm a patient under their care and thoroughly recommend their practice to anyone looking for a kind, caring & personal service.

title: Professional and Protected
body: Didnt think my scan would still go ahead. It did. I was met wt the door by  a young lady wearing full protective clothing, gloves, masks and apron. There was only myself the young lad and the chap who did my scan who also wore all protective clothing in the whole building. Evident they had opened it to make sure they were able to keep seeing their patients. Which i was really grateful for. I was able to keep my own gloves and face mask on. As professional and comfortable experience as one can hope in these times. Grateful. Thank you

title: Quality care
body: My father has just returned home after a two week stay here following a week in hospital. On arrival, we were all made welcome and Dad's comfort and preferences were priorities. His room and en suite were spotless, tasteful and comfortable. The whole place was more like a hotel than a care home! The staff were cheerful, caring and professional. Nothing was too much trouble. While it was hard not to be able to visit during the second week due to coronavirus lockdown, we were reassured to know he was in such good hands. Thank you all so, so much.

title: Paramedics brilliant
body: Just wanted to say a huge thank you to paramedics that was sent to me on Sunday by 111 service, they gave me steroids straightaway and arranged emergency prescription did all my checks to rule out if it was my heart causing me not to breath well, they treat me at home and were fantastic sorting prescriptions and stating if I did start with chest pains phone back we need more thanks and praise for the paramedic service.... Did not have to go to hospital to be sent home with no treatment very grateful for this and advised to self isolate very happy with paramedics that serve Sheffield and surrounding areas they are the unsung heroes of the NHS and need more praise nneeds to be given to paramedics

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing nurses
body: I've recently had 5 b12 injections over the last 2 weeks at this surgery and the nurses have been incredible. I had a fear of needles and I can now say that I'm over this fear because of the staff. Absolutely brilliant, even through the corona virus crisis. One nurse in particular is a credit to the practice, and I would love to be able to mention her here! It was easy to make appointments, and the communication from this practice was fab.

title: great practice friendly staff
body: I have attended this practice for almost three years and have always found all the doctors, nurses and reception staff to be very good. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this practice.

author: Second class citizen
title: Nottingham gender service
body:
Waiting for over two years now like many many others. I feel like am I left with one choice, suicide or self medicate hormones sourced internationally from the internet while having no checks on health. Will I get seen this year? Who knows.  
While on the waiting list I've changed name, accessed potentially unsafe drugs, gained a voluntary global role for gender identity, and started to train to become a gender identity councillor. This all before actually having a single gender nhs appointment.  
How is this acceptable?

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Fantastic service
body: I used the econsult service which I initially had trouble completing so I called the practice. The receptionist was extremely helpful in her advice so that I was able to complete it. I received a reply from the doctor with very specific personalised advice on how to treat my ailment. This is a fantastic service especially at a time when we are trying to avoid social contact. Thanks to all at the Clements surgery for the work you are doing to keep us all safe and well

title: very helpful
body: dont tend to see the doctors very much but the nurses i see arw always polite and very good at what they do

title: Great practice
body: I dont have a bad word to say about the practice. Staff, Gp's, nurse's, midwives are super friendly and efficient. Myself and my son have always received the best care.

title: Terrible experience
body: I have been treated like a second rate citizen by this practice, rude and hostile towards me despite being extremely polite. Admin is flawed and if you attempt to complain via appropriate channels you will swiftly be threatened with removal. Terrible and disgusting.

title: Service is very poor
body: Staff are friendly but not passionate..i couldnt see any duty of care , it was more like getting the patient in and out ..shame as its a big hospital but staff need so much training .

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: So grateful....
body:
I've left a positive review previously but during these trying times, I felt that I wanted to comment again.
I was undergoing investigative procedures relating to lower back pain which was understandably suspended. Within days of this I began experiencing crippling sciatic pain.
I use the electronic service the majority of the time and did so this time - I had a call back and advice within 3 hours of the practice opening!
All round superb service at St Andrews.

title: Love Staploe Medical Centre
body: Just been appalled by reading some of the reviews left for Staploe Medical Centre - they are the best practice I have ever dealt with.  Been with them 4 yrs now and the staff are lovely, the online booking service has speeded up making an appointment (no waiting for days to see a GP) and text messages are really helpful.  Can't recommend them enough!

title: Great department
body: Visted the gynecological department yesterday and despite the trying times that the NHS are under everyone one from the security outside to the receptionist were brilliant. A massive thanks to the consultant and nursing staff who kept me calm and reassured during procedure

title: Remarkably good, considering Covid 19
body:
Like every other practice, they are under extreme pressure at the moment but without exception, the staff are friendly, helpful and willing to "go the extra mile" to help with unusual issues. 
My last GP employed staff with no medical qualifications who demanded on knowing my symptoms before "granting" me a requested appointment -  I cannot believe any of the staff I have met so far would dream of doing that!
At the moment, we can't make appointments, but when you arrange a telephone interview with a doctor at a certain time, THE DOCTOR RINGS YOU AT THAT TIME! How good is that???
I haven't seen a doctor yet but have had cause to speak to three different ones for issues regarding my partner and I and all three LISTENED (a skill sadly lacking from most GP's I have encountered previously), asked pertinent questions (which to me, showed their genuine interest!) and then said they would  prescribe the relevant medication which was then available at their dispensary a few hours later!
Before you think I may be getting paid for leaving this review, I will say that their administration (paperwork and the like) has not been brilliant but, given the circumstances of this lockdown, the desired result has always been reached, albeit with some minor delays. If everything else is anything to go by, I fully expect this area to be better when the world returns to normal!
Looking at the reviews on here, I must be honest that I had hoped to register at another practice because of their better "scores" but was told because of where I live, I had no choice but to use this medical centre - my experience of them so far suggests I should be grateful to the God of Dumb Luck as overall, they are fantastic!
Now I have posted this, watch them change their wonderful staff for a bunch of miserable old $%^&.......

title: Amazing practice
body: Took my youngest son for his 3rd lot of immunizations today (07.04.2020) and I must say well done to the whole team there!! The protocols and steps they have in place is amazing!! Having to go in the side door and actually be let in by a nurse after confirming your appointment, Checking both mine and sons temperature, hand gel, escorted to the nurses room and then escorted back out to where they'll give you more hand gel. All of this whilst they are wearing full PPE (which they're running out of) and having distance in place. Of course I did my part and wore my mask too the whole time. Hope everyone stays safe and a thank you to the whole surgery 👏🌈💕

title: Amazing staff
body: Having an abortion is never going to be a nice process, but I can't thank all the staff at the clinic enough for making me feel so comfortable and welcome whilst I was there. I can't put into words how much it helps to have supportive and friendly staff in the clinic (as I had originally planned to have my treatment elsewhere but left after feeling very judged & uncomfortable), but the staff at Richmond were absolutely incredible in making me feel comfortable the whole time I was there. Especially with the pressures everyone has been facing with the Covid-19 pandemic, I truly cannot recommend BPAS Richmond enough.

title: Caring, friendly, family Practice
body: This is an extremely caring practice, whose attention to detail when treating its patients is first rate. Given my occupation, the staff bend over backwards to accomodate me and will often ring in advance to book a review at a time that is most convenient to me. The care from all the medical staff I received leaves me feeling like a person rather than a statistic. The name Partington Family Practice gives the greatest endorsement because you are consistently treated like you are a member of their own family. When attending GP appointments, despite the time contraints and GP workload  I have never felt rushed, I feel listened to, I am always consulted on every part of my treatment.  It always feels as though I am visiting an old friend albeit a respected friend who is not afraid to dispense advice to me that I might not akways want to hear. Partington Family Practice is everything a community practice should be and I am privileged to have such exemplary medical professionals caring for me.

title: PTSD Consultation- Bad Service made me more…
body:
1.	Price and Service Hour inconsistent with telephone enquiry
 
I booked one hour with Dr xxx at £350. I received an invoice of £360. The time booked was changed to 50 minutes rather than an hour.
 
2.	Over-charging
 
The next day, Dr xxx asked me to pay an extra £180 before consultation because he needs to read some documents I sent about my symptoms. 
 
3.	Unprofessional question
 
Dr xxx asked me where I was. I said I stayed with a friend. He asked me “do you have sex with him?” I straightforward rejected him and said “I am not going to answer it”.
 
4.	Mistakes in Report; Missing points in Report
 
There are some mistakes in the Report which I think do not represent my situation because Dr xxx did not listen carefully to me, or misunderstood my answer. I corrected them. I also noticed Dr Xxx did not include my further information into the Report so I supplemented them.
 
Dr xxx refused to amend his Report on the ground that the later supplemented information was not given in the interview.
 
However, (1) Dr xxx agreed in writing to include my later submitted information into the Report; (2) Dr xxx himself included my AQ10 Result into the Report which was done after the Interview.
 
It is unreasonable not to include my supplemented information into the Report.
 
5.	Incomplete Interview and Inaccurate Result
 
I was not interviewed fully in the telephone consultation which leads to my answers incomplete, and this leads to inaccurate Report. The way Dr Xxx conducted interview only gives partial and inaccurate result.
 
Truth is very important to me- I do not try to cover up any my mental illness and likewise I do not want to exaggerate it. I do not need support, help or whatever because I enjoy being independent, but I paid for it and deserve a proper Report which is accurate. I cannot accept a Report which is more or short for my real mental status.
 
6.	Anxiety and Waiting- Patient’s Needs not Met and Patient Made Mentally Worse
 
After Dr xxx’s service I went worse. The Admins (some of them) are very quick and pleasant when they ask for payment, but became withdrawn, slow and hiding when I made my complaint. My anxiety does not allow me to tolerate their blowing hot and cold. I need care and support, rather than more abuse and exploitation.
 
7.	Warnings from others
 
My GP doctor and another organisation raised some concerns which worked as a red flag or warning to me.
 
8.	Rejected me for further service
 
Dr. xxx told me if I reject treatment there is no point to further give me consultation. I asked another psychiatrist in Psychiatry-UK, and received a rejection after 48 hours which was long for my anxiety. I made a complaint against Dr xxx but was told it will take 15 working days.

author: MichelleH
title: 5 year old daughter with rare disease, shielding list concerns
body:
We have a 5 year old daughter with Trichothiodystrophy, this is a life-limiting rare genetic condition that affect her by means of a developmental delay, It affects her sight, hearing, speech, weight and growth. She has a highly compromised immune system and we rely on Nutrini tube feeding, which is done via a peg in her tummy.  
In accordance with Scottish Government guidance published on 26/3 regarding the shielding list, as part of the ongoing Covid-19 pandemic. Annex A, item 4 of this guidance states that those with . "those with rare diseases and inborn errors of metabolism that significantly increase the risk of infections" are those that should be on the shielding list and are at the highest risk. This relates to our daughter specifically.  
We are currently self-isolating and are a family of 4, we have been in isolation for almost 6 weeks. We have had no phone call or letter from the Scottish Government, NHS Scotland or health services we attend as part of our daughter's care to confirm our shielding status.  
We are finding isolation increasingly difficult as we cannot shop for ourselves and supermarket deliveries are booked up over a month in advance. This is causing myself and my husband increased anxiety and concern in an already very difficult and worrying situation.  
I have been very proactive in calling and emailing services to try and resolve the situation, but find myself going round in circles and noone can give me the information we require.  
We believe there may have been an error as the shielding system does not have our daughter's DoB on it and she has not been identified as someone at risk.

readBy.name: Office of Clare Haughey, MSP for Rutherglen
South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences
University of Glasgow - School of Medicine, Dentistry and Nursing

title: NHS is truly priceless
body:
I came into UHCW A&E with a badly fractured left ankle on Fri 3rd Apr. The foot was just flapping around. The A&E guys gave me a couple of shots of morphine before wrenching the dislocated ankle straight, then put a temp plaster on the leg and sent me up to Ward 52.

A young consultant came to explain that they were intending to operate on me the following morning. The operation was about 3 hours long using a spinal anaesthetic. I was awake, and when they projected the X-ray display on the back wall I could see that they had a metal plate down the outside of the leg, and were drilling through the bone and putting screws through to the metal plate to fix the broken bits together. The anaesthetist gave me a simplified running commentary on what was going on. The surgeons ended up putting a surgical boot over the foot and lower leg to hold everything securely.

In the evening after the operation, a physio team came to give me practice at using a walking frame, taking care not to put weight on the left leg. The first couple of steps were quite tricky, but I succeeded in going to the loo and washing my hands at the hand-basin without mishap.

I stayed a second night Sat 4th-Sun 5th Apr in Ward 52, looked after by the extremely helpful and friendly nurses and auxiliary staff. I give them 10 out of 10 on every point.

On Sun I had another visit by the physio guys who gave me a short course on walking on crutches. I had a couple of visits by the doctors and the nurses to explain the conditions of my discharge and what I had to do next.

The whole experience was wonderfully positive, and I have already told everyone I have met (online only) that the NHS is truly priceless. The guys in UHCW Ward 52 were an absolute delight.

About 10 years ago I had a much more minor operation in a good quality US hospital, and had to pay a few hundred dollars for every small item - a shoulder splint from A&E 70 bucks, hospital non-slip socks 70 bucks etc. (eventually I got my occupational insurance company in on the act). Quite apart from the money paid in advance  (taking 3 blood samples, sending them to 3 different laboratoris for analysis, each paid separately), the time and worry about dealing with many dozens of small but expensive items was totally maddening.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Wouldn’t trust these people to look after my cat!!
body: Absolutely diabolical place. No staff interaction with the residents, extremely rude staff. If you want your loved one shoved in front of a tv all day then this is the place to be! Staff look constantly miserable, the place is really grotty. Dirty chairs, nothing for the residents to do except stare at tv or sleep. Even the bed linen I’ve seen looks like it’s older than some of the residents. I have even witnessed a resident ask to go to bed to be told she would have to wait by a member of staff as she was going for a cup of tea first.

title: Professional Consistent Caring Practice
body:
I have been a patient for this practice for more that thirty years,
the support and professional care and attention from the GP's and all the Staff is excelent. I have several ongoing medical issues, all of which have been dealt with in a excelent way.
I would recomend the practice and the GP's; here, as they are particularly knowledgable about Diabetes and Mental Heath Issues.
For anyone looking for a new GP Practice, I would strongle recommend the Droylsden Road Medical Practice.
Admin staff are attentive and helpfull and the GP's are always thorough and very supportive.
I feel that this practice derserves recognition as being a consistent and caring practice.
Throught my illness and medical problems, I have always been kept informed and had things explained, I feel this aspect of the service is excelent.
Thank you Daniel Wilson 07/04/20

title: Great ward
body: After my son has had a horrible cough for some time an visiting out of hours a couple of an it still not going I rang the doctors and they got up to the hospital to see the paediatric doctors. All of the nursing staff was lovely welcoming and really helpful after a bit of waiting we saw the doctor who decided an X-ray was needed to check his chest. We waited a couple of hours an was still not taken down. The doctor decided to take a walk to X-ray to try get us down quicker witch it did. Although I know the staff are under a lot of pressure they was great with me an my son. Making sure we was all protected for our own heath. Thank you

title: This has to be the worst GP service in the UK
body: Not for the first time, I have been let down by this practice. trying to get am appointment is almost impossible. I had to visit Bridgwater MIU twice in two days and was told to see my GP ASAP as my blood pressure was too high. When I did speak to a GP at the practice, I was told that the MIU equipment was probably not working correctly and to go to Taunton A&E. It was only after my second visite to the Bridgwater MIU and the staff calling the practice did they give me an appointment. I have now been keeping a blood pressure diary for two weeks as asked to by the GP and have emailed this information to the practice, however, when I have called them to speak to the doctor, all I get are more delaying tactics from the receptionist. Very disappointed with the service.

author: Tonkaw
title: Mindfulness
body:
Was able to participate,in a mindfulness course,run by three exceptional mentors in Emily,Eva,& Tina  
The course was over 10 weeks,in Baptist church in dumfries  
Course content was exceptional.  
It was rolled out to help with pain,and yes IT DOES HELP  
Thanks for allowing me to partake ,and good luck in the future WELL DONE

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Lack of care
body: My IVF treatment has just been cancelled mid-way through the cycle due to COVID-19. I have been waiting years for this opportunity, and though I understand there may be rationale in cancelling, the way this was handled was with great indifference. Firstly, no one actually got in touch with me, so I continued taking hormones and I had to call and ask before they confirmed the cycle was cancelled. When they did confirm, I was given no reason, other than just a mention of COVID-19. It would have been helpful to know if this was due to lack of capacity, or risk to the treatment or future pregnancy. I was then told I would get a call when they're ready to start treatment and the nurse hung up. This was obviously devastating for me, though the nurse showed no compassion and cancelled my cycle with no explanation, no assurance of how and when I may be able to start again (even if this is unknown, it should have been stated). In inductions, the Drs stress how important mental health is, and how emotionally tolling the process of IVF is. They ask us as patients to reach out to them for support during treatment as they are there to help, however I have rarely been treated with much compassion about my feelings or emotions in the RMU clinic. The staff do not 'practice what they preach' and if at all possible I will be looking for treatment elsewhere, and would not recommend anyone who can avoid it to have treatment here. If possible, find a clinic where the nurses and doctors are caring.

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

author: LD9595
title: Fantastic care
body:
Being a nurse, I never thought I would be on the other side as a patient any time soon. Admitted to ward 211, then 208 during a time of uncertainty,I was felt reassured and relaxed at the kindness, compassion and professionalism of all staff, from portering, HCSWs, to staff nurses and medical staff. Massive well done also to get dental nurses redeployed to help.  
Although my stay was brief (thankfully), I wanted to express how greatful I am to them. Keep going and stay safe ! #proudtobenhsg!

author: The fat controller
title: Nurse who was absolutely superb
body:
On a recent visit to the cardiology department at Hairmyres hospital I was seen by nurse Helen who was absolutely superb. Helen was very thorough, professional and listened in detail to my chest complaint. She made recommendations to my GP and I am now feeling pain free and in good health.  
Thank you for such attentive care.  
Good luck and keep safe during this testing time.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership
South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

title: 5 star practice
body: The care that you have provided me while I've battled a chronic infection for nearly 3 years now has gone a long way towards keeping me from becoming totally overwhelmed. More than you probably know. Dealing with end of life issues facing multiple members of my family ran parallel to this so my whole situation has been a huge challenge for me, throughout which you have treated me with immense respect & kindness. I know it is frustrating for you when you can't pull a cure out of the bag but I hope you will rest assured that your continued calm manner, kindness & respect is helping us, your patients, more than can be tangibly measured as we all face the overwhelming challenges that COVID-19 brings with it. From the bottom of my heart, thank you for all you do.

author: Caravan2
title: 2year old knee replacement
body: I am having terrible pain and swelling in knee finding it hard to walk can I be put back on list as I know you are not doing any surgery because of the virus please can you help

author: TheCapedCrusader
title: Protection for the staff based at outpatients is minimal
body:
Having had reason to use this department on many occasions I have always been happy with the service I have received, the staff couldn't be more attentive and helpful.  
What I do find concerning is that whilst the rest of the hospital is being redesigned to cope with the coronavirus outbreak (additional signage, barriers, etc) the protection for the staff based at outpatients is minimal. Just for example, across the foyer there is the RVS shop, which has clearly marked squares to maintain social distancing whilst waiting to pay a cashier that is protected by a plastic screen. These screens are unobtrusive and still allow you to be seen and understood whilst affording the staff protection from any germs that may be transmitted.  
Looking at the outpatients area and the reception in particular there are some markings on the floor which are laid out in a haphazard way and certainly aren't two metres apart, there are no screens or any form of PPE available to the staff manning the desk. Whilst I appreciate that it is a designated "green" area, patients are not screened at the main entrance and questions about any COVID symptoms are asked at the reception desk, therefore the first person they meet is unprotected. The acquisition of screens similar in design to those in the RVS shop will afford some protection to staff.  
Come on Dr Grays management, give these wonderful staff the protection they deserve in these trying times!

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students
